Constructor Summary
PController(int bandCenter, int bandwith, int motorStraight)

Method Summary
 void bothMotorsStraight()
          sets both motors to the same speed

          prints to usb console the current speeds of both motors

 float recalculateSpeed()
          returns quantity to modify motor speeds.
 void rightMotorFaster(float differential)
          sets right motor to higher speed proportional to error, sets left motor to normal speed to increase turning radius allow for full 180 turns more easilly

Constructor Detail

PController

public PController(int bandCenter,
                   int bandwith,
                   int motorStraight)
Default constructor Initialises the member variables and starts the motor at a desired speed going forward

Parameters:
bandCenter - desired distance from the wall
bandwith - allowed buffer region
motorStraight - normal cruisong speed
Method Detail

processUSData

public void processUSData(int distance)
Proportional controller implementation speeds up and down wheels proportionnaly to the distance to the wall

Specified by:
processUSData in interface UltrasonicController
Parameters:
distance - distance to the wall

rightMotorFaster

public void rightMotorFaster(float differential)
sets right motor to higher speed proportional to error, sets left motor to normal speed to increase turning radius allow for full 180 turns more easilly

leftMotorFaster

public void leftMotorFaster(float differential)
sets left motor to higher speed proportional to error, sets right motor to lower speed proportional to error.

bothMotorsStraight

public void bothMotorsStraight()
sets both motors to the same speed

recalculateSpeed

public float recalculateSpeed()
returns quantity to modify motor speeds. Calculation based on the current distance, band center, and a proportionality constant.

printMotorDistances

public void printMotorDistances()
prints to usb console the current speeds of both motors
